page.title: 01Outline of Charnwood
page.content: This area lies 10Km NW of Leicester & E of the M1 1Km N of Junction 22 and is a remnant of the ancient Charnwood forest a high and rocky volcanic outcrop.Inhabited sparsley but continuously from early times it is now a well maintained rural landscape of isolated farms and houses mixed arable and grassland and small patches of woodland in the S & E.To the W is the hamlet of Copt Oak and E is the country park of Beacon Hill.The area is of outstanding natural beauty and much enjoyed locally for countryside recreation.Main roads are M1 along the W edge,an ancient EW route now the B591 & 2 NS routes the B5330 to Shepshed & B5350 to Loughborough.The population is small partly due to planning policies.People live there by choice in a comfortable lifestyle with modern services and private transport.
